cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 420 miles SSW of Apalachicola, FL
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn north-northeast and track toward the northwest Florida Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Indian Passâ€“Anclote River, FL (Big Bend area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Anclote River to Indian Pass, FL; Tropical Storm Watch: Indian Pass westward to Walton/Bay County line, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast from Tampa Bay northward through the Big Bend and eastward across the peninsula
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible Thursday with only a 5 % chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (34 kt).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Alabama coast due to an east-of-port landfall.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to locally moderate rain bands possible Thursday; totals generally under 2 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough Gulf seas and elevated wave action could affect pilot transfers and berth operations.
